title: Drawing, "Design for a clock", 1800–25
medium: Brush and yellow, red, brown, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper
inscribed: Lower right, brown ink: No. 10 "un femme assie et une / lire sur la Boite / ditte le souvenir
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Base, supported by claw feet, its front panel decorated with four putti, two with a bow and arrow. Clock dial above at left incased in the front of a table with cloth. A lyre stands on top of table. At right, a seated woman in classical dress, her arm outstretched, holding a book.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a clock", 1800–25.
1800–25. Brush and yellow, red, brown, watercolor, pen and black ink, graphite on cream laid paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-132.
